title: Cope Hood, 15th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: supplementary warp in a plain weave foundation (velvet) with metallic supplementary weft
provenance: ex. coll. Antonio Vives y Escudero
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 37 x 42.5 cm (14 9/16 x 16 3/4 in.)
description: Pomegranate in gold on a ground of blue velvet. Shape of textile is that of a cope hood.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cope Hood, 15th century.
15th century. Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: supplementary warp in a plain weave foundation (velvet) with metallic supplementary weft. Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-394.
